abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            rated as satisfactory. The following lessons can be drawn:
            1) It is crucial to rely on continuity and not sacrifice
            project supervision while prematurely preparing a parallel
            project. 2) Technical assistance needs to be carefully
            monitored and based on clear terms of reference and if well
            targeted can support local capacity and help develop a
            greater sense of responsibility and ownership from the
            central and local governments. 3) Effective and efficient
            solid waste collection can be provided in large cities like
            Conakry by small scale local private contractors using low
            cost technologies. 4) Financing of solid waste collection
            can be achieved through direct collection of user charges
            when services are regularly provided and households are
            willing to pay. 5) Up front and appropriate compensation and
            clearing of customary land tenure are fundamental to any
            urban land development program. 6) Bank and borrower
            commitments are paramount for project success.

abstracts.cdata!:
This project will assist the Government
            in implementing its urban strategy and consolidate the basis
            for sustainable urban development.  It fits within the
            framework for improving Guinea's economic
            infrastructure.  Project objectives are the following : 1)
            improve key urban infrastructure and services; 2) support
            new land development operations; 3) develop private sector
            role, including small scale construction enterprises in
            provision of housing, land development and urban services;
            4) strengthen municipal governments.  To accomplish these
            ends, the project has the following components : a) priority
            infrastructure program including upgrading of key
            infrastructure in Conakry and selected secondary cities; b)
            support for implementation of a new housing policy; c)
            continuation of the program to assist the development of
            small construction enterprises; and d) development of urban
            institutions including support to improve MUH's project
            management capacity.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Urban Project will assist the
            Government in implementing its urban strategy and
            consolidate the basis for sustainable urban development. It
            fits within the framework for improving Guinea's
            economic infrastructure. The project objectives are the
            following: 1) improve key urban infrastructure and services;
            2) support new land development operations; 3) develop
            private sector role, including small scale construction
            enterprises in provision of housing, land development and
            urban services; and 4) strengthen municipal governments. To
            accomplish these ends, the project has the following
            components: a) priority infrastructure program including
            upgrading of key infrastructure in Conakry and selected
            secondary cities; b) support for implementation of a new
            housing policy; c) continuation of the program to assist the
            development of small construction enterprises; and d)
            development of urban institutions including support to
            improve MUH's (Ministry of Urban Planning end Housing)
            project management capacity.

The Second Urban Project will assist the
            Government in implementing its urban strategy and
            consolidate the basis for sustainable urban development. It
            fits within the framework for improving Guinea's
            economic infrastructure. The project objectives are the
            following: 1) improve key urban infrastructure and services;
            2) support new land development operations; 3) develop
            private sector role, including small scale construction
            enterprises in provision of housing, land development and
            urban services; and 4) strengthen municipal governments. To
            accomplish these ends, the project has the following
            components: a) priority infrastructure program including
            upgrading of key infrastructure in Conakry and selected
            secondary cities; b) support for implementation of a new

            development of small construction enterprises; and d)

            improve MUH's (Ministry of Urban Planning end Housing)
